scandal.question: Did you try to lead someone else into committing a sinful act through your words, actions, or influence?
scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

impenitence.question: Have I refused to acknowledge my personal wrongdoing, stubbornly clinging to it?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

impenitence.question: Have I refused to acknowledge my wrongdoing, even when confronted with the truth about myself?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

impenitence.question: Have I refused to acknowledge my wrongdoing, allowing pride to lead me in hiding from God's mercy?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: by speaking harsh words that reflected my own hurt and anger , rather than freely offering mercy
anger.question: Did I deny forgiveness to someone who wronged me by speaking harsh words that reflected my own hurt and anger, rather than freely offering mercy?
anger.description: Refusing to forgive others is sinful because it contradicts Jesus's direct command to forgive and His example of mercy, while also blocking God's forgiveness of our own sins.

blasphemy.question: Did you swear to God?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

extracted_data_phrases: in a moment of frustration or anger
blasphemy.question: Did you, in a moment of frustration or anger, swear to God?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion in my heart, while knowing myself to be unworthy?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: in a state of mortal sin
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion in a state of mortal sin, knowing full well that my intentions and heart were not in alignment with God's will?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

greed.question: Did I make accumulating wealth, possessions, and material comforts a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Did I make accumulating wealth, possessions, and material comforts a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: through my actions , deeds , or exercises of power
oppression.question: Did I unjustly mistreat others through my actions, deeds, or exercises of power?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: in unjust and cruel exercises of power , authority , or influence over others
of power , authority , or influence over others
through my words , actions , or decisions
oppression.question: Did I engage in unjust and cruel exercises of power, authority, or influence over others through my words, actions, or decisions?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: to their appearance , usefulness , or what they could do for you ,
rather than seeing their full humanity
lust.question: Did you reduce others to their appearance, usefulness, or what they could do for you, rather than seeing their full humanity?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

lust.question: Did I reduce others to their usefulness in my interactions, focusing on what they can do for me rather than seeing them as full individuals?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: for the blessings in my life
autonomy.question: Did I give thanks for the blessings in my life without acknowledging God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

presumption.question: Did you assume that your accomplishments and successes in life were solely due to your own efforts, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence and guidance?
presumption.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I felt envy towards others' successes, and secretly wished they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: in a manner that was vulgar or inappropriate due to my own thoughtlessness
in conversations about topics that may be of little interest to them
about topics that may be of little interest to them
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others in a manner that was vulgar or inappropriate due to my own thoughtlessness, especially when engaging in conversations about topics that may be of little interest to them?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
to a lack of control over my own desires
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, potentially leading to a lack of control over my own desires?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when alone, and did this lead to an excessive attachment to worldly pleasures and a rejection of the call to temperance?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when it comes to fine dining experiences that might distract you from living a virtuous life?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing faults or private affairs about others
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing faults or private affairs about others, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' personal matters through words, even if true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in activities on Sunday , when it could have been avoided without grave necessity
on Sunday , when it could have been avoided without grave necessity
impiety.question: Did I unnecessarily involve myself in activities on Sunday, when it could have been avoided without grave necessity?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

impurity.question: Did you use practices, substances, or objects to prevent pregnancy?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.
